required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics, Safety and Immunogenicity of Single Doses of Belatacept Administered Subcutaneously to Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: Pharmacokinetics, Bioavailability, Safety and Immunogenicity of Single Doses of Belatacept Administered Subcutaneously to Healthy Subjects

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Serum Concentration (Cmax) of Belatacept
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed serum concentration (Cmax) values were derived from serum concentration versus time data and reported in micrograms per milliliter (ug/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Time of Maximum Observed Serum Concentration (Tmax) of Belatacept
primary_outcome.description: Time of maximum observed serum concentration (Tmax) values were derived from serum concentration versus time data for all participants treated with Belatacept.

primary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Geometric Means of Area Under the Serum Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUC(0-T)) for Belatacept
primary_outcome.description: Area under the serum concentration-time curve from time zero to the time of last quantifiable concentration (AUC(0-T)) was derived from serum concentration versus time data. Adjusted geometric means were reported in microgram hours per milliliter (ug*h/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Geometric Means of Area Under the Serum Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time (AUC(INF)) for Belatacept
primary_outcome.description: Area under the serum concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time (AUC(INF)) was derived from serum concentration versus time data. Adjusted geometric means were reported in microgram hours per milliliter (ug*h/mL)
Serum half-life (T-HALF) was determined from serum concentration versus time data and was reported in hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Total Body Clearance (CLT/F) of SC Belatacept
primary_outcome.description: Apparent total body clearance (CLT/F) was derived from serum concentration versus time data for all participants who received subcutaneous (SC) Belatacept injections. Units reported in milliliters per hour (mL/h).

primary_outcome.measure: Total Body Clearance (CLT) of IV Belatacept
primary_outcome.description: Total body clearance (CLT) was derived from serum concentration versus time data for all participants that were treated with IV Belatacept. Units reported in milliliters per hour (mL/h)

primary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (VSS) for IV Belatacept
primary_outcome.description: Volume of distribution at steady state (VSS) was derived from serum concentration versus time data for all participants treated with IV Belatacept.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss/F) for SC Belatacept
primary_outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution at steady state (Vss/F) was derived from concentration versus time data for all participants treated with subcutaneous (SC) Belatacept.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Number of Injection Sites on Subcutaneous Belatacept Absorption
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-T) and AUC(INF) for Belatacept were derived from serum concentration versus time data to assess the effect of number of injection sites on the subcutaneous absorption of Belatacept. All treatments were dose-normalized to 50mg. Adjusted geometric means reported in microgram hours per milliliter (ug*h/mL). AUC(0-T) = Area Under the Serum Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of Last Quantifiable Concentration. AUC(INF) = Area Under the Serum Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Vital Sign Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: Vital signs (body temperature, respiratory rate, seated blood pressure, and heart rate) were recorded at screening. All significant findings were evaluated by the investigator, and all abnormalities were listed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Injection Site Reactions
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were assessed for erythema, heat, pain, pruritis and swelling at the injection sites and were characterized by the investigator as mild, moderate or severe reactions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Physical Examination Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: All clinically significant deviations from normal physical examinations were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: Participants underwent a 12-lead ECG assessment at Screening (Day 1) and Study Discharge (Day 116). All investigator-assessed ECG abnormalities were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Marked Hematology Laboratory Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Hemoglobin (grams per deciliter:g/dL): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Hematocrit (%): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Platelet Count (*10^9 cells per liter:c/L): <0.85*LLN or >1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx). Leukocytes (*10^3 cells per microliter: c/uL): <0.9*LLN, >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx or >ULN, if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.15*Pre-Rx or <LLN) Neutrophils+Bands (*10^3 c/uL): <=1.500. Lymphocytes (*10^3 c/uL): <0.750 or >7.500. Monocytes (*10^3 c/uL): >2.000. Basophils (*10^3 c/uL): >0.400. Eosinophils (*10^3 c/uL): >0.750.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Marked Serum Chemistry Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Alkaline Phosphatase (units per liter: U/L), Aspartate Aminotransferase (U/L), Alanine Aminotransferase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Bilirubin (milligrams per deciliter: mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Blood Urea Nitrogen (mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.2*Pre-Rx). Creatinine (mg/dL): >1.33*Pre-Rx. Sodium (milliequivalents per Liter: mEq/L): <0.95*LLN, >1.05*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.95*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.05*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Potassium(mEq/L), Chloride (mEq/L), Calcium(mg/dL): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Phosphorus (mg/dL): <0.85*LLN, >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, <0.85*Pre-Rx, >ULN. if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx, <LLN).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Marked Laboratory Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Glucose (mg/dL): <0.8*LLN, >1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.8*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >2.0*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Protein (grams per deciliter: g/dL): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Albumin (g/dL): <0.9*LLN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx). Uric Acid (mg.dL): >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx). Lactate Dehydrogenase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.5*Pre-Rx)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Positive Immunogenicity to Belatacept
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with positive immunogenicity to Belatacept was reported for each arm. Positive immunogenicity was defined as the presence of a positive antibody response generated against Belatacept.

intervention.description: Subcutaneous injection of placebo solution (product ID: 224818-N000- 029)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women ages 18 to 65 years old
- Subjects must weigh less than or equal to 100 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to tolerate injections or IV infusions
- autoimmune disorders
- TB
- herpes
- HCV
- HBV
- HIV
- bacterial or viral infection
- history of cancer

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 153 participants were enrolled, with 106 discontinuing prior to study drug administration because they no longer met study criteria or they withdrew consent. 47 participants met all eligibility criteria and received study medication. 1 subject, who received an incomplete dose due to an injection syringe leak, was replaced.

group.title: Belatacept 50 mg Subcutaneous Injection
group.description: Belatacept 50 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection into anterior thigh, 0.4 mL injection volume

group.title: Belatacept 100 mg Subcutaneous Injection
group.description: Belatacept 100 mg SC injection into anterior thigh, 0.8 mL injection volume

group.title: Belatacept 125 mg Subcutaneous Injection
group.description: Belatacept 125 mg SC injection into anterior thigh, 1.0 mL injection volume

group.title: Belatacept 150 mg Subcutaneous Injections
group.description: Participants received 2 SC injections of 75 mg Belatacept each, in the anterior thighs. One injection was given in each thigh, with the second injection immediately following the first injection.

group.title: Belatacept 200 mg Subcutaneous Injections
group.description: Participants received 2 SC injections of 100 mg Belatacept each, in the anterior thighs. One injection was given in each thigh, with the second injection immediately following the first injection.

group.title: Belatacept 250 mg Subcutaneous Injections
group.description: Participants received 2 SC injections of 125 mg Belatacept each, in the anterior thighs. One injection was given in each thigh, with the second injection immediately following the first injection.

group.title: Belatacept 125 mg Intravenous Infusion
group.description: 125 mg Belatacept intravenous (IV) injection

group.description: Subcutaneous injection of placebo solution (product ID: 224818-N000- 029)

outcome.title: Effect of Number of Injection Sites on Subcutaneous Belatacept Absorption
outcome.description: AUC(0-T) and AUC(INF) for Belatacept were derived from serum concentration versus time data to assess the effect of number of injection sites on the subcutaneous absorption of Belatacept. All treatments were dose-normalized to 50mg. Adjusted geometric means reported in microgram hours per milliliter (ug*h/mL). AUC(0-T) = Area Under the Serum Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of Last Quantifiable Concentration. AUC(INF) = Area Under the Serum Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time.

group.title: 1 Injection Site
group.description: Participants receiving treatments of 50mg, 100mg and 125mg Subcutaneous Belatacept were injected at 1 site at the anterior thigh.

group.title: 2 Injection Sites
group.description: Participants receiving treatments of 150mg, 200mg and 250mg Subcutaneous Belatacept were injected at 2 sites; one injection equal to half the total dose was delivered to the anterior thigh on each side.

measure.title: Effect of Number of Injection Sites on Subcutaneous Belatacept Absorption
measure.description: AUC(0-T) and AUC(INF) for Belatacept were derived from serum concentration versus time data to assess the effect of number of injection sites on the subcutaneous absorption of Belatacept. All treatments were dose-normalized to 50mg. Adjusted geometric means reported in microgram hours per milliliter (ug*h/mL). AUC(0-T) = Area Under the Serum Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of Last Quantifiable Concentration. AUC(INF) = Area Under the Serum Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time.

analysis.estimate_desc: AUC(0-T) Ratio of Geometric Means: 1 injection site over 2 injection sites
AUC(INF) Ratio of Geometric Means: 1 injection site over 2 injection sites

measure.title: Number of Participants With Vital Sign Abnormalities
measure.description: Vital signs (body temperature, respiratory rate, seated blood pressure, and heart rate) were recorded at screening. All significant findings were evaluated by the investigator, and all abnormalities were listed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Injection Site Reactions
outcome.description: Participants were assessed for erythema, heat, pain, pruritis and swelling at the injection sites and were characterized by the investigator as mild, moderate or severe reactions.

measure.description: Participants underwent a 12-lead ECG assessment at Screening (Day 1) and Study Discharge (Day 116). All investigator-assessed ECG abnormalities were reported.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Marked Hematology Laboratory Abnormalities
outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Hemoglobin (grams per deciliter:g/dL): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Hematocrit (%): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Platelet Count (*10^9 cells per liter:c/L): <0.85*LLN or >1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx). Leukocytes (*10^3 cells per microliter: c/uL): <0.9*LLN, >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx or >ULN, if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.15*Pre-Rx or <LLN) Neutrophils+Bands (*10^3 c/uL): <=1.500. Lymphocytes (*10^3 c/uL): <0.750 or >7.500. Monocytes (*10^3 c/uL): >2.000. Basophils (*10^3 c/uL): >0.400. Eosinophils (*10^3 c/uL): >0.750.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Marked Hematology Laboratory Abnormalities
measure.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Hemoglobin (grams per deciliter:g/dL): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Hematocrit (%): <0.85*Pre-Rx. Platelet Count (*10^9 cells per liter:c/L): <0.85*LLN or >1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx). Leukocytes (*10^3 cells per microliter: c/uL): <0.9*LLN, >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, use <0.85*Pre-Rx or >ULN, if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.15*Pre-Rx or <LLN) Neutrophils+Bands (*10^3 c/uL): <=1.500. Lymphocytes (*10^3 c/uL): <0.750 or >7.500. Monocytes (*10^3 c/uL): >2.000. Basophils (*10^3 c/uL): >0.400. Eosinophils (*10^3 c/uL): >0.750.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Marked Serum Chemistry Abnormalities
outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Alkaline Phosphatase (units per liter: U/L), Aspartate Aminotransferase (U/L), Alanine Aminotransferase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Bilirubin (milligrams per deciliter: mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Blood Urea Nitrogen (mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.2*Pre-Rx). Creatinine (mg/dL): >1.33*Pre-Rx. Sodium (milliequivalents per Liter: mEq/L): <0.95*LLN, >1.05*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.95*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.05*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Potassium(mEq/L), Chloride (mEq/L), Calcium(mg/dL): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Phosphorus (mg/dL): <0.85*LLN, >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, <0.85*Pre-Rx, >ULN. if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx, <LLN).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Marked Serum Chemistry Abnormalities
measure.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Alkaline Phosphatase (units per liter: U/L), Aspartate Aminotransferase (U/L), Alanine Aminotransferase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Bilirubin (milligrams per deciliter: mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.25*Pre-Rx). Blood Urea Nitrogen (mg/dL): >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN, use >1.2*Pre-Rx). Creatinine (mg/dL): >1.33*Pre-Rx. Sodium (milliequivalents per Liter: mEq/L): <0.95*LLN, >1.05*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.95*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.05*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Potassium(mEq/L), Chloride (mEq/L), Calcium(mg/dL): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Phosphorus (mg/dL): <0.85*LLN, >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN, <0.85*Pre-Rx, >ULN. if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx, <LLN).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Marked Laboratory Abnormalities
outcome.description: LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx=Value before first dose. Lab values that met the following criteria were marked as abnormalities: Glucose (mg/dL): <0.8*LLN, >1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.8*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >2.0*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Protein (grams per deciliter: g/dL): <0.9*LLN, >1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx, >ULN. If Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx, <LLN). Albumin (g/dL): <0.9*LLN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.9*Pre-Rx). Uric Acid (mg.dL): >1.2*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx). Lactate Dehydrogenase (U/L): >1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.5*Pre-Rx)

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Positive Immunogenicity to Belatacept
outcome.description: The number of participants with positive immunogenicity to Belatacept was reported for each arm. Positive immunogenicity was defined as the presence of a positive antibody response generated against Belatacept.

reported_events.time_frame: From Day 1 until 30 days post discontinuation of dosing, up to August 2008 (approximately 8 months)
reported_events.desc: Study initiated: December 2007 Study completed: August 2008 Participants underwent regularly scheduled investigator assessments and clinical laboratory evaluations as described in the study protocol.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
